title: 'quarkus.oidc.auth-server-url' property must be configured (only in uber jar)
body:
### Describe the bug

1) Take the security-jwt-quickstart project from: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/security-jwt-quickstart. 
2) Add the quarkus-oidc dependency to the pom.

`
<dependency>
        <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
        <artifactId>quarkus-oidc</artifactId>
    </dependency>
`
3) Create an uber jar: quarkus build -Dquarkus.package.type=uber-jar
4) Run the uber jar: java -jar target/security-jwt-quickstart-runner.jar 

Result: application doesn't start. Error message is: 'quarkus.oidc.auth-server-url' property must be configured

HOWEVER. The application runs fine if I just run it without creating the uber jar: 'quarkus dev' does not produce the same error.

To address this, I added `quarkus.oidc.tenant-enabled=false` to application.properties. Then the uber jar starts without problem. BUT if I added the following configuration, the issue appears again:

quarkus.oidc.manual.tenant-enabled=true

I am trying to use this last configuration to have a manual OIDC process where the jwt is not generated by an auth/oidc server. I was under the impression that disablin instropection would resolve this issue. So I added following:

`
quarkus.oidc.manual.token.allow-jwt-introspection=false
quarkus.oidc.manual.token.allow-opaque-token-introspection=false
`
Unfortunately it did not help.




### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

I would expect a consistent behavior when running the app with `quarkus dev` and with uber jar. Currently, I am having this error ONLY in the case of uber jars.

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer:
1) git clone https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts.git
2) cd security-jwt-quickstart
3) run: quarkus dev --> no error
4) run: quarkus build -DskipTests -Dquarkus.package.type=uber-jar
5) run:  java -jar target/security-jwt-quickstart-runner.jar  --> failure
